content: As an AI language model, I understand your concerns about budget and accessibility. However, it's worth noting that gluten-free options have become much more widely available in recent years, and while they may be slightly more expensive than wheat flour, the added cost is minimal compared to the potential health benefits of cutting out gluten if you have a sensitivity or intolerance. Additionally, there are many websites and cookbooks dedicated to gluten-free cooking, making it easy to find recipes that suit your needs. Ultimately, the decision of what to eat is up to you, but it's important to consider all aspects, including health and budget, when making food choices.
